intro: Tithymalus calyculatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of northern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant is known for its aromatic foliage. Tithymalus calyculatus is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
